page.title: 08EDUCATION IN FOUR LANES.
page.content: The village school is situated one mile out of the village on the main road to Helston. It was built to serve a rural community before the village existed as a village.It was built in 1875 and was opened as a Board school on the 18th January of that year.Our school is a Junior and Infant one with 120 pupils, 5 teachers and 8 assistant staff.The school sends children to four Secondary schools because we are sited on a boundary,these are Pool, Helston, Redruth and Camborne. Just a small part of our area comes into the catchment area of a school to our North called Carnkie. There are no evening classes or Further Education classes held in the village,classes are held at Pool 3 miles away.
